alert.note: Alert for Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHWESTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northeast of Dunken, or 21 miles northwest of Hope, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Lincoln and southwestern Chaves Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Lincoln County; Southwest Chaves County
